Key Match Events: Donovan Mitchell sank a jumper with only three-tenths of a second remaining, sealing the win for the Cleveland Cavaliers
Others: The Milwaukee Bucks endured a heartbreaking defeat against the Cleveland Cavaliers on Saturday, losing 114-113. This marks the Bucks' fifth consecutive loss, leaving them with a disappointing 1-5 record through six games.
The Bucks struggled to find additional scoring outside of Damian Lillard and Giannis Antetokounmpo, with the remaining players managing only 38 points.
Gary Trent Jr. struggled offensively, connecting on just one of his 10 attempts from the field, recording three points, three turnovers, and three personal fouls.
The Bucks' three-point shooting improved significantly in this matchup, shooting a remarkable 46% from beyond the arc.
Doc Rivers made a notable change to the rotation, giving rookie Andre Jackson Jr. extended minutes over Pat Connaughton, whose defensive lapses had hurt the Bucks in previous games.
